      public Writer()

  • Method Details

    • writeStoreJSON

      public static void writeStoreJSON(Store store)
      Writes a new store in the "Stores.txt" file and creates empty files for the store's products and tickets.
      Parameters:
      store - The Store object to be written in the file.

    • createProductJSON

      public static org.json.JSONObject createProductJSON(Product product)
      This method creates a JSONObject representing a Product object. The JSONObject includes the ID, reference, name, quantity, price, and type of the product. If the product is of type Tree, the height of the tree is also included. If the product is of type Flower, the colour of the flower is also included. If the product is of type Decoration, the material of the decoration is also included.
      Parameters:
      product - The Product object to convert into a JSONObject.
      Returns:
      A JSONObject representing the Product object.

    • writeProductJSON

      public static void writeProductJSON(org.json.JSONObject productJSON, String storeName)
      Writes a JSON representation of a product to a file with the name of the store. The name of the file will be "Products" followed by the trimmed store name. The JSON object passed as a parameter will be written into the file.
      Parameters:
      productJSON - The JSON representation of the product to be written to the file.
      storeName - The name of the store that the product belongs to.

    • addProductJSON

      public static void addProductJSON(Product product, String storeName)
      Adds a new product to the store catalog in JSON format. Converts the Product object to a JSONObject and writes it into a file named Products[storeName].txt.
      Parameters:
      product - The product to be added to the store catalog.
      storeName - The name of the store where the product will be added.

    • removeProductJSON

      public static void removeProductJSON(String ref, String storeName)
      Removes the JSON object of a product with a given reference, from the file storing the products of a given store. The file is updated by creating a temporal file, copying all the products except the one to remove, and then replacing the original file.
      Parameters:
      ref - The reference of the product to remove.
      storeName - The name of the store where the product is stored.

    • updateProductJSON

      public static void updateProductJSON(Product product, String storeName)
      Updates a product in a store's products file by removing the old version of the product and writing the updated version to the file.
      Parameters:
      product - The updated product to write into the file.
      storeName - The name of the store the product belongs to.

    • writeTicketJSON

      public static void writeTicketJSON(Ticket ticket, String storeName)
      Writes a ticket object in JSON format to a file for a given store.
      Parameters:
      ticket - The Ticket object to be written into the file.
      storeName - The name of the store associated with the ticket.
